alert.note: Alert for Arlington, Falls Church, Alexandria; Eastern Loudoun; Fairfax; Western Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 27 at 2:19PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM EST SUNDAY THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of DC, including the following , District of Columbia, Maryland, including the following areas, Anne Arundel, Central and Southeast Howard, Central and Southeast Montgomery, Northwest Howard, Northwest Montgomery, Prince Georges and Southern Baltimore, and northern Virginia, including the following areas, Arlington/Falls Church/Alexandria, Eastern Loudoun, Fairfax and Western Loudoun. * WHEN...From 1 AM EST Sunday through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Saturated soils combined with moderate to locally heavy rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2 inches could result in areas of flooding. 6-hour rainfall totals could exceed 1 inch in many spots early Sunday morning. - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Arlington, Falls Church, Alexandria; Eastern Loudoun; Fairfax; Western Loudoun
